name: CONCORDIA 40
notes:
The first 4 CONCORDIA 40's were built in the US. The rest were imported from Germany. A slightly larger version (see CONCORDIA 41) was imported after WWII. (26 boats) 
Concordia's were built with an oak keel, steam bent oak frames, African mahogany planking, varnished mahogany deck trim, a canvas covered main deck and house top, bronze plank fastenings, and galvanized keel bolts through a iron keel. 
There were a few variations from this including the occasional lead keel. 
Rig Options: Fractional Sloop & Yawl, Masthead Sloop & Yawl. 
It is said that nearly all of this type are still sailing.
